rationale: 'very quickly' modifies an adverb, not a risk-adjective.
statement_text: The acting chief executive of the Australian Chicken Growers Council, Dr Joanne Sillince, said any egg supply issues were a 'short-term blip that will resolve itself very quickly.' 'You have got a whole bunch of new pullets coming into production every week,' she [Dr Joanne Sillince] said, referring to young hens.

rationale: The segment does not contain a high-potency verb, potent metaphor, or other Q2 Alarmist cue.
